name: Body
description: Provides methods for adding and updating the content of an item in an Outlook add-in.

methods.name: getAsync
methods.description: Returns the current body in a specified format.

parameters.name: coercionType
parameters.description: The format for the returned body.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: An object literal that contains one or more of the following properties. For more information on defining and using the `options` parameter, see {@tutorial options}.

parameters.name: options.asyncContext
parameters.description: Developers can provide any object they wish to access in the callback method.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The body is provided in the requested format in the `asyncResult.value` property.

methods.name: getTypeAsync
methods.description: Gets a value that indicates whether the content is in HTML or text format.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: An object literal that contains one or more of the following properties. For more information on defining and using the `options` parameter, see {@tutorial options}.

parameters.name: options.asyncContext
parameters.description: Developers can provide any object they wish to access in the callback method.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The content type is returned as one of the [CoercionType]{@link Office.CoercionType} values in the `asyncResult.value` property.

methods.name: prependAsync
methods.description: Adds the specified content to the beginning of the item body.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The string to be inserted at the beginning of the body. The string is limited to 1,000,000 characters.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: An object literal that contains one or more of the following properties. For more information on defining and using the `options` parameter, see {@tutorial options}.

parameters.name: options.coercionType
parameters.description: The desired format for the body. The string in the `data` parameter will be converted to this format.

parameters.name: options.asyncContext
parameters.description: Developers can provide any object they wish to access in the callback method.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Any errors encountered will be provided in the `asyncResult.error` property.

methods.name: setAsync
methods.description: Replaces the entire body with the specified text.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The string that will replace the existing body. The string is limited to 1,000,000 characters.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: An object literal that contains one or more of the following properties. For more information on defining and using the `options` parameter, see {@tutorial options}.

parameters.name: options.coercionType
parameters.description: The desired format for the body. The string in the `data` parameter will be converted to this format.

parameters.name: options.asyncContext
parameters.description: Developers can provide any object they wish to access in the callback method.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Any errors encountered will be provided in the `asyncResult.error` property.

methods.name: setSelectedDataAsync
methods.description: Replaces the selection in the body with the specified text.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The string to be inserted in the body. The string is limited to 1,000,000 characters.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: An object literal that contains one or more of the following properties. For more information on defining and using the `options` parameter, see {@tutorial options}.

parameters.name: options.coercionType
parameters.description: The desired format for the body. The string in the `data` parameter will be converted to this format.

parameters.name: options.asyncContext
parameters.description: Developers can provide any object they wish to access in the callback method.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Any errors encountered will be provided in the `asyncResult.error` property.
